entries.meaning: (acting) a person who shares star billing
examples: The once famous actor objected to his costar having a bigger dressing room.

entries.meaning: (acting) a person who slightly lacks the status to be considered a star
examples: Alas, always a costar but never a star.

verbs.description: costar (third-person singular simple present costars, present participle costarring, simple past and past participle costarred)

entries.meaning: to perform with the billing of a costar.
examples: People thought his career was over but now he will get to costar on Broadway next month.
